channel.title: [HELP]Compiling with apache ant
channel.description:
Hey guys, I know a decent amount of java, but I summed up on a problem...
Im trying to compile my decompiled code with apache ant but I just can not get the bat file to pause up on compiling, yes I have ant installed with the following...
Ant location: [code]C:\apache-ant-1.8.2[/code]
Ant Path: [code] Name: PATH Env: C:\apache-ant-1.8.2\bin; [/code]
Compile.bat: [code] @echo off ant -buildfile .\build.xml pause [/code]
But what ever I try it does not pause
[b]Note:[/b] I added "pause" to the bottom of ant.bat in my ant/bin folder!
Proof ant is installed: [code]C:\Users\Kerry> ant version Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li b\tools.jar Buildfile: build.xml does not exist! Build failed
C:\Users\Kerry> ant -version Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li b\tools.jar Apache Ant(TM) version 1.8.2 compiled on December 20 2010[/code]
So according to cmd>ant -version, It is for sure installed, can someone please point me in the right way for pausing the compile.bat please.
Also let me know if the build.xml needs adding, thanks for looking and hope u can help me.

item.title: [HELP]Compiling with apache ant
item.dc:creator: @MaNsIkKa MaNsIkKa
item.description:
@MaNsIkKa wrote:

[quote=“putaz, post:7, topic:405073”][quote author=MaNsIkKa link=topic=502077.msg3673520#msg3673520 date=1311101669]
answer to my Question… if u got any ideas
[/quote]

Got where have you ant apache. / probably c:\ant…

So goto:
C:\ant\bin\ant.bat
and edit it, goto the bottom of it and after
:omega
write pause…

save and recompile you server.[/quote]

yeah worked now , thanks alot.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP]Compiling with apache ant
item.dc:creator: @MaNsIkKa MaNsIkKa
item.description:
@MaNsIkKa wrote:

Ok, now my ant is compiling good, but still there is no pausing the .bat file after compiling is done, I added “pause” in ant/bin ant.bat + in my compile .bat also copyed the tools.jar over.
any ideas? thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP]Compiling with apache ant
item.dc:creator: @putaz putaz
item.description:
@putaz wrote:

Download Java JDK to get the Tools.jar. Will not work otherwise.
Ant must have a build file, ant does not know what to compile otherwise!

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP]Compiling with apache ant
item.dc:creator: @MaNsIkKa MaNsIkKa
item.description:
@MaNsIkKa wrote:

Hey guys, I know a decent amount of java, but I summed up on a problem…

Im trying to compile my decompiled code with apache ant but I just can not get the bat file to pause up on compiling, yes I have ant installed with the following…

Ant location:

Ant Path:

Name: PATH
Env: C:\apache-ant-1.8.2\bin;

Compile.bat:

@echo off
ant -buildfile .\build.xml
pause

But what ever I try it does not pause

Note: I added “pause” to the bottom of ant.bat in my ant/bin folder!

Proof ant is installed:

[code]C:\Users\Kerry> ant version
Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li
b\tools.jar
Buildfile: build.xml does not exist!
Build failed

C:\Users\Kerry> ant -version
Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li
b\tools.jar
Apache Ant™ version 1.8.2 compiled on December 20 2010[/code]

So according to cmd>ant -version, It is for sure installed, can someone please point me in the right way for pausing the compile.bat please.

Also let me know if the build.xml needs adding, thanks for looking and hope u can help me.

Read full topic
